Here we briefly explain the framework of federate learning and recent research on the mode-connectivity, which are the backbone of our approach.
The symbols that we use throughout the paper are listed in TableÂ 1.

references:
TableÂ 4 summarizes all hyperparameters that were used for each data set-model configuration throughout all non-IID splits. We train all models for a total of 500 communication rounds, except for ResNet18 on Tiny-ImageNet, which we train for 100 communication rounds. Moreover, we train each setting using a total of 100 clients, of which we select 10 randomly to participate in training in each communication round, except for SimpleCNN on CIFAR-10 where we select 30 out of 100 clients to participate in each round. We evaluate all clients after every ten communication rounds.
For CIFAR-10 we train a SimpleCNN with batch size 50 using SGD with a learning rate of 0.02 and a pre-trained SqueezeNet with learning rate of 0.001 and batch size 32. For Tiny-ImageNet we train a pre-trained ResNet18 with batch size 32 using SGD with a learning rate of 0.01, and a MobileNetV2 with batch size 64 and learning rate 0.01. We use SGD as an optimizer with momentum set to 0.9 for all runs except for SimpleCNN on CIFAR-10 where momentum is set to be 0.5. Moreover, we set weight decay to 10âˆ’4superscript10410^{-4} for all runs except for SimpleCNN on CIFAR-10 where it is set to 0.5, and for SqueezeNet on CIFAR-10 where it is set to 0.
For FedProx we set the proximity hyperparameter to Î¼=0.01ğœ‡0.01\mu=0.01 for SimpleCNN on CIFAR-10, Î¼=0.1ğœ‡0.1\mu=0.1 for SqueezeNet on CIFAR-10, Î¼=0.1ğœ‡0.1\mu=0.1 for MobileNetV2 on Tiny-ImageNet, and lastly Î¼=10âˆ’3ğœ‡superscript103\mu=10^{-3} for ResNet18 on Tiny-ImageNet.
For SosicFL+ we set the local epochs to the same value as epochs for the global model Ï„=Eğœğ¸\tau=E. We set the cluster number hyperparameter to S=10ğ‘†10S=10 for all Dirichlet-based experiments, and to S=2ğ‘†2S=2 and S=5ğ‘†5S=5 for the 2-Fold and 5-Fold experiments, respectively. The number of samples that we sample on each client for training to Î©tâ€‹r=1subscriptÎ©ğ‘¡ğ‘Ÿ1\Omega_{tr}=1 for SosicFL and to Î©tâ€‹r=10subscriptÎ©ğ‘¡ğ‘Ÿ10\Omega_{tr}=10 for SosicFL+ and the number of samples for ensembling at test time to Î©tâ€‹e=1subscriptÎ©ğ‘¡ğ‘’1\Omega_{te}=1 for both SosicFL and SosicFL+. All training hyperparameters for CIFAR-10 on a SimpleCNN where taken from Hahn etÂ al. (2022), CIFAR-10 on a pre-trained SqueezeNet from Nguyen etÂ al. (2022), Tiny-ImageNet on a pre-trained ResNet18 from Chen etÂ al. (2022b), and Tiny-ImageNet on MobileNetV2 from Shi etÂ al. (2023).

We group the methods into two groupsâ€”with (Ditto and SosicFL+)
or without (FedAvg, FedProx, and SosicFL) additional personalization steps111
Note that these personalized approaches require additional computational resources on each client as they train two models.
â€”and highlight the best method in each group in bold.
Ditto and SosicFL+ are excluded from the evaluation on 2-Fold setting because the setting is too close to IID.
The performance in terms of TTA improvement is reported in TableÂ 5 in AppendixÂ C.
Below we explain each experiment in detail.
